[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Airline Operations Management System (AOMS) defines requirements for managing airline flights, crew assignments, and aircraft operations.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: AOMS supports flight scheduling, crew assignments, maintenance tracking, and operational reporting.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: AOMS integrates with airline databases, airport systems, and crew records for scheduling and compliance.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: AOMS provides web and mobile dashboards for administrators, pilots, and flight schedulers.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: AOMS supports in-flight systems, ground control workstations, and crew mobile devices.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: AOMS uses PostgreSQL for structured storage, REST APIs for scheduling and tracking.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: AOMS secures communications via TLS encryption and two-factor authentication.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: AOMS is optimized for high-volume flight operations and real-time crew scheduling.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: AOMS is configurable for airlines with diverse operational needs and regulatory environments.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: AOMS integrates with air traffic control, weather monitoring, and fuel management systems.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 MISSING-TAG2: AOMS manages flight scheduling, crew availability, and aircraft maintenance tracking.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: AOMS manages flight schedules, crew assignments, aircraft maintenance, and operational reports.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: AOMS is designed for airline administrators, flight schedulers, pilots, and maintenance teams.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: AOMS relies on accurate flight schedules, crew availability, and regulatory compliance.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Pilot: Certified crew member responsible for aircraft operation.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 MISSING-TAG1: AOMS requires continuous network connectivity for real-time tracking and operations.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall manage flight scheduling, crew assignments, reservations, and maintenance tracking (REQ-DB-001, REQ-DB-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall generate operational reports on flight performance, crew activities, and maintenance status (REQ-DB-003).

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with airport databases for flight schedules, tracking, and maintenance synchronization.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall connect with crew transport systems for personnel scheduling and transfers.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process scheduling and crew assignments within 2 seconds.

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an interactive dashboard for flight scheduling and crew management.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store flight schedules, reservations, stopovers, aircraft status, and crew assignments.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The system shall store crew details, including availability, certifications, and assigned flights.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-003: The system shall store flight history, maintenance logs, and regulatory compliance records.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with aviation safety and operational regulations.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall log schedule updates, flight status changes, and maintenance activities.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 MISSING-TAG3.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall enforce authentication, encryption, and access control mechanisms.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Tests scheduling, crew assignments, aircraft tracking, and compliance reporting.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User manuals, API documentation, and compliance guidelines.
[SEC] 5. References: Aviation regulations, airline policies, and maintenance standards.
